_header: I-written I find a good story / The Pope it wrote Saint Gregory
Subjects: Trental of St Gregory; Gregory, saint; exempla

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
I Writen I fynde a good storiÞe Pope hit wrot seint
                    Gregori…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Þe same hom Go vs seendeTo wone wiþ him wiþ
                    outen ende Amen
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

Horstmann,  Carl.

         8 (1885): 275-7: 275.
Kaufmann,  Albert. 
             Trentalle Sancti Gregorii; eine mittelenglische Legende.
Erlanger Beiträge

Horstmann,  Carl,
                        ed.  
             The Minor Poems of the Vernon Manuscript, Part 1.
EETS

OxfBal354.First Lines:
I ffynde wretyn a noble storythe pope it wrote seynt
                    gregory…
OxfBal354.Last Lines: …that we ther in may the seeAmen Amen ffor Charyte
OxfBal354.Attributed Title:
Trentale Sancti / Gregorij pape (p. 283); Explicit trentale
                        Sancti Gregorie (p. 286)
OxfBal354.Facsimiles:
Early Manuscripts at Oxford University: Facsimile
                    of Oxford, Balliol MS 354.
         (http://image.ox.ac.uk/show?collection=balliol&manuscript=ms354).

Lam306.First Lines:
I writt men ffynt a fayre stryeThe Pope hit wrote Seint
                    gregorye…
Lam306.Last Lines:
…That is In hevyn with oute endyngPray we all that hit so
                    beAmen Amen par charite
Lam306.Attributed Title:
here folowth Sent gregoris Trentall (f. 110, in a later hand); Explicit
                    Sent Gregorys Trentall (f. 113v, in a later hand)
Lam306.Editions:
Kaufmann,  Albert. 
             Trentalle Sancti Gregorii; eine mittelenglische Legende.
Erlanger Beiträge
         3. Erlangen and Leipzig: Deichert, 1889: 25.

PULGar143.First Lines:
I ffynde wreten a good storieþe pope of rome it wrot seynt
                    gregorieOff his moder & of hure liifThat men helden an holi
                    wif…
PULGar143.Last Lines:
…To þat ioie he vs bryngeThat is in heuene with outen
                    endyngPraye we alle þat hit so beAmen Amen pur
                    charite
PULGar143.Editions:
Root,  Robert Kilburn. 
             “Poems from the Garrett MS.” 
             Englische Studien
         41 (1910): 360-79: 365-71.

CantAdd46.First Lines:
…y fynd ywhyten a nobyl story…pope it wrott seynt
                    gregorie…
CantAdd46.Last Lines:
…but swych as we þu sest me herey am þi modir
                    þat ye se
CantAdd46.Note:
The text survives on a series of damaged parchment fragments, resized on
                    uniform paper sheets.
CantAdd46.Editions:
Boffey,  Julia,  and  A. S. G. Edwards.  
             “Unrecorded Middle English Verse Texts in a Canterbury Cathedral Library
                Manuscript.” 
             Medium Ævum
         72 (2003): 49-62: 50-4.
